title: Font Suggestion: Irish Pub Fonts
content:
Hello,

I have a client that is wanting a font that would be similar to one that could be found at an Irish Pub. I have looked around and have yet to find anything that will work. I was wondering if you could provide me with some recommendations.

Thanks  
Scott Forbes
author: WSXF

comments.content: I haven't made it it Ire, yet, but there seems to be a lot of great [hand-lettered pub signs](http://web.archive.org/web/20150315165457/http:/www.flickr.com/photos/pauldhunt/sets/72157602552287340/) all around England. In this vein, I'd check out stuff from LHF [Stratford](http://web.archive.org/web/20150315165457/http:/www.letterheadfonts.com/fonts/stratford.shtml) might be one to look at.

If you wanna beat the cliché, pick an [uncial](http://web.archive.org/web/20150315165457/http:/typophile.com/wiki/uncial): [FontShop](http://web.archive.org/web/20150315165457/http:/www.fontshop.com/search/?q=uncial), [MyFonts](http://web.archive.org/web/20150315165457/http:/www.myfonts.com/browse/keyword/uncial/). Typophile Dan has compiled [a list of gems](http://web.archive.org/web/20150315165457/http:/www.typeoff.de/?p=183), and he has designed [a nice one himself](http://web.archive.org/web/20150315165457/http:/www.typeoff.de/?p=24), too.

I searched on [kells](http://web.archive.org/web/20150315165457/http:/www.myfonts.com/search?search%5Btext%5D=kells) at myfonts.com and got some possibilities, although "irish uncial" would probably give you much the same results.

Later edit:

[Dining Pubs](http://web.archive.org/web/20150315165457/http:/www.diningpubs.com/) and [Irish Music Bars](http://web.archive.org/web/20150315165457/http:/www.irishmusicbars.com/) have extensive lists of Irish pubs, along with photographs; although the photos are somewhat small, you can often see the signs pretty well.

Go to:  
 [http://www.scribhinn.org/gailear.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20150315165457/http:/www.scribhinn.org/gailear.html "http://www.scribhinn.org/gailear.html")

The page is in Irish, but if you scroll to the bottom you will see a photo of a book cover flanked by arrows to the left and right. Click on either arrow to navigate forwards or backwards through a gallery of images of Irish typefaces employed in different contexts.

The gallery contains several pictures of Irish pub signs.

This may or may not help... [  
Gaelic script](http://web.archive.org/web/20150315165457/http:/en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gaelic_script/)

and some pubs in and around Belfast...  
 [  
The Hatfield](http://web.archive.org/web/20150315165457/http:/www.gotobelfast.com/link_open.cfm?id=http://www.thehatfield.com/)  
 [  
Magenniss](http://web.archive.org/web/20150315165457/http:/www.gotobelfast.com/link_open.cfm?id=http://www.magenniss.com/)  
 [  
Kellyscellars](http://web.archive.org/web/20150315165457/http:/www.kellyscellars.com/images/Kellys1.jpg/)  
 [  
FibberMagees](http://web.archive.org/web/20150315165457/http:/www.flickr.com/photos/ironbed/446482580/)

alot of pubs in Ireland go for a more contemporary look these days...  
 [  
JohnHewitt](http://web.archive.org/web/20150315165457/http:/www.flickr.com/photos/67165210@N00/1805161337/)

Sorry, first link didnt work. Try here...

[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gaelic\_script](http://web.archive.org/web/20150315165457/http:/en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gaelic_script "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gaelic\_script")
